at Mr. Colin Powell 's contention that he was misled by faulty intelligence into making the public case for the invasion of Iraq. " Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody," Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes. Nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie.[ CIA Director President Bush ] Tenet did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie.... The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Even so, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld -- who does reveal that former President Bush asked for Iraq invasion plans within days of 9/11-- argues that removing Saddam Hussein was the right thing to do. Gabrielle Giffords , Colin Powell said he was dismayed by the harsh tenor of political debate that some have said may have contributed to the attack. There has crept in our society and our public dialogue, a coarseness, a nastiness, an attack of people who don't share the same views as you do, he said. "All sorts of nastiness. . Alyse Eady performed her musical ventriloquist act, "I Want to Be a Cowboy's Sweetheart," for the pageant crowd. Her platform in the Miss Arkansas and Miss America pageants highlighted the issue of Developing Leaders: Boys& Girls Clubs of America. Since the pageant, Alyse Eady , 22, has continued to be presented to the public with appearances scheduled on Late Show With David Letterman and Inside Edition on CBS and on the MSNBC cable news network.
